comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Terrific photo! At Circular Quay West, where the Overseas Passenger Terminal now is. About 11/12/1914 according to the SMH of that date - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15556912 . Amused to see the Shell Benzine delivered by horses!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] We were very excited when we found this one, particularly as it hadn't yet been catalogued as AURORA! So now we can add to our Antarctic images. We were also amused to see Shell take advantage of an advertising opportunity 1914-style :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 49548560@N05
comment._content: Can anyone remember who it was who was left in charge of the Aurora & the Ross Sea party while Shackleton & his party in the Endurance were over in the Weddell Sea direction?

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: Hi [http://www.flickr.com/photos/49548560@N05]! Some good info on Ross Sea Party personnel over at Antarcticguide.com: www.antarcticguide.com/about-antarctica/antarctic-history...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
